intro: Alatiglossum unicolor, commonly known as the single-colored alatiglossum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many ornamental and horticulturally important species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
